models.clients: Companies or organizations you work with. Each client has stakeholders, opportunities, and projects.
models.stakeholders: Key contacts within a client organization. Tagged with MEDDPICC roles like Champion or Economic Buyer.
models.opportunities: Sales deals tracked through your pipeline. Move through stages from Lead to Closed Won/Lost.
models.activities: Logged interactions like calls, meetings, and emails. Creates a timeline of engagement.
models.competitors: Other companies or solutions being considered in a deal.

relationships: Each Client has many Stakeholders (the people you work with)
Each Client has many Opportunities (deals in your pipeline)
Each Opportunity can have Activities logged against it
Each Activity can involve one or more Stakeholders
Opportunities can mention Competitors being evaluated

meddpicc.metrics: Reduce ticket resolution time by 40%, achieve 95% SLA compliance, decrease IT support costs by $200K annually
meddpicc.decisionCriteria: Must integrate with ServiceNow, require SOC2 compliance, need 99.9% uptime SLA
meddpicc.decisionProcess: Technical evaluation (Feb) → Security review (Mar) → CFO approval (Apr) → Legal/procurement (May)
meddpicc.paperProcess: Standard MSA required, 30-day payment terms, procurement contact is Lisa Chen
meddpicc.identifiedPain: Current ITSM tool causing 3-hour average resolution times, team frustrated with manual workflows
meddpicc.competition: Evaluating ServiceNow (expensive) and Freshservice (lacks enterprise features)

meddpicc.decisionCriteria: Cloud-native solution, must support hybrid deployment
meddpicc.identifiedPain: Legacy system end-of-life in Q3, need migration path

meddpicc.metrics: Automate 80% of routine IT requests, reduce help desk staff by 2 FTEs
meddpicc.decisionCriteria: Self-service portal required, mobile app for technicians
meddpicc.decisionProcess: Pilot with IT team (complete) → Expand to HR (current) → Company-wide rollout
meddpicc.paperProcess: Using existing vendor agreement, NET 45 terms
meddpicc.identifiedPain: IT team overwhelmed with password resets and access requests
meddpicc.competition: Considered building in-house but timeline too aggressive

meddpicc.identifiedPain: Production line downtime costing $50K per incident

meddpicc.decisionProcess: Lost to competitor in final stage
meddpicc.competition: Lost to MedIT Pro - had healthcare-specific modules

stakeholders.name: Sarah Chen
stakeholders.title: VP of IT Operations
stakeholders.notes: Strong advocate internally. Frustrated with current tool for 2 years. Met her at ServiceNow conference.

stakeholders.name: Michael Torres
stakeholders.title: CFO
stakeholders.notes: Cost-focused. Wants clear ROI documentation. Prefer email over calls.

stakeholders.name: Jennifer Wu
stakeholders.title: IT Security Manager
stakeholders.notes: Running security assessment. Concerned about data residency.

stakeholders.name: David Park
stakeholders.title: Director of Procurement
stakeholders.notes: Helped us navigate their procurement process. Former colleague of our CEO.

stakeholders.name: Robert Martinez
stakeholders.title: CTO
stakeholders.notes: Interested but hard to reach. Traveling frequently.

stakeholders.name: Amanda Foster
stakeholders.title: IT Director
stakeholders.notes: Driving the project internally. Weekly sync calls.

stakeholders.name: Kevin O'Brien
stakeholders.title: VP of Finance
stakeholders.notes: Skeptical of ROI. Wants to see pilot results before expansion budget.

stakeholders.name: Emily Watson
stakeholders.title: Plant Manager
stakeholders.notes: Initial contact. No follow-up meeting scheduled yet.

opportunities.name: HIPAA Compliance Automation
opportunities.lossReason: Competitor had healthcare-specific compliance modules we couldn't match

activities.subject: Discovery call with Sarah and team
activities.description: Walked through current pain points. Sarah demonstrated their existing workflow - lots of manual ticket routing. Team excited about automation possibilities.

activities.subject: Sent proposal document
activities.description: Delivered comprehensive proposal with 3 pricing tiers. Included ROI analysis as requested by CFO.

activities.subject: Budget discussion with David
activities.description: David shared that Q2 budget is approved. Suggested we push for signature before April board meeting.

activities.subject: Security assessment review
activities.description: Jennifer walked through her security checklist. Two items flagged: data residency (we can address) and penetration test (scheduled for next week).

activities.subject: Internal strategy note
activities.description: CFO seems hesitant on timeline. Recommend bringing ROI case study from similar manufacturing client to next meeting.

activities.subject: Initial discovery with Robert
activities.description: Brief call. Robert interested but delegating technical evaluation to his team. Need to identify who that is.

activities.subject: Weekly sync with Amanda
activities.description: Pilot going well. 85% satisfaction from IT team. Amanda pushing for HR expansion. Kevin still needs convincing.

activities.subject: ROI data for Kevin
activities.description: Sent detailed breakdown showing $120K annual savings projection based on pilot metrics. Amanda will present to Kevin.

competitors.name: ServiceNow
competitors.strengths: Enterprise scale, broad ecosystem, strong brand recognition
competitors.weaknesses: Expensive, complex implementation, long deployment cycles
competitors.notes: Often seen as 'safe choice' but budget is a concern for mid-market

competitors.name: Freshservice
competitors.strengths: Easy to use, quick setup, competitive pricing
competitors.weaknesses: Limited enterprise features, basic reporting, fewer integrations
competitors.notes: Good for SMB but struggles with complex enterprise requirements

competitors.name: MedIT Pro
competitors.strengths: Healthcare-specific compliance modules, HIPAA certified, industry expertise
competitors.weaknesses: Narrow focus, limited to healthcare, smaller company
competitors.notes: Won Umbrella Health deal. Strong in regulated healthcare verticals.

competitorMentions.notes: Acme got a quote from ServiceNow but balked at the price. Our main competition.
Initially considered Freshservice but ruled out for lacking SSO and advanced workflows.
Umbrella chose MedIT Pro for their healthcare-specific HIPAA modules.
